channel.title: Comments on: Sonic Youth on Gossip Girl: Ugh

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: SJM, you clearly didn't watch the show or you would be aware that in this particular episode Dorota calls them, "the Sonic Youths." Poser.
item.content:encoded: SJM, you clearly didn’t watch the show or you would be aware that in this particular episode Dorota calls them, “the Sonic Youths.” Poser.

item.title: By: SJM
item.dc:creator: SJM
item.description: Fascinating blog--is it all about the commodification of punk/prog-rock/emo/indie/goth/etc? Just a mini-critique: I'm sorry but you've humiliated yourself by calling Sonic Youth "The Sonic Youths." I will now humiliate myself by saying that I am addicted to Gossip Girl, and that I worship Sonic Youth and have since I first encountered them in middle school, 20-some years ago (not said for cred but to celebrate their staying power). Re: Gossip Girl, the whole BS narrative of Rufus and Lily, and how often the writers get things *almost right* in their references to 90s indie music is just so wrong. When Dan said something about "math rock" I almost sh*t myself! I love it, it's like watching a train wreck. I keep wondering if anyone's writing any critical theory about all this stuff--Hot Topic, Urban Outfitters, and now Burberry et al--let's sell punk! If you know of any scholarly works on this stuff, please let me know. xoxo
item.content:encoded: Fascinating blog–is it all about the commodification of punk/prog-rock/emo/indie/goth/etc? Just a mini-critique: I’m sorry but you’ve humiliated yourself by calling Sonic Youth “The Sonic Youths.” I will now humiliate myself by saying that I am addicted to Gossip Girl, and that I worship Sonic Youth and have since I first encountered them in middle school, 20-some years ago (not said for cred but to celebrate their staying power). Re: Gossip Girl, the whole BS narrative of Rufus and Lily, and how often the writers get things *almost right* in their references to 90s indie music is just so wrong. When Dan said something about “math rock” I almost sh*t myself! I love it, it’s like watching a train wreck. I keep wondering if anyone’s writing any critical theory about all this stuff–Hot Topic, Urban Outfitters, and now Burberry et al–let’s sell punk! If you know of any scholarly works on this stuff, please let me know. xoxo

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: Amusingly, while watching Monday's episode I was debating whether I preferred Kiki or Lily. I sided with Kiki. I miss Seth, too.
item.content:encoded: Amusingly, while watching Monday’s episode I was debating whether I preferred Kiki or Lily. I sided with Kiki. I miss Seth, too.

item.title: By: Eric Greenwood
item.dc:creator: Eric Greenwood
item.description: yeah, the show completely sucks. it's so poorly written and laughably ludicrous. the O.C. was so much better. viva seth cohen!
item.content:encoded: yeah, the show completely sucks. it’s so poorly written and laughably ludicrous. the O.C. was so much better. viva seth cohen!

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: GG has definitely jumped the shark. Last night's show was just bad bad bad. Kim was clearly uncomfortable and it was really uncomfortable to watch. WTF were they thinking? Ugh is right.
item.content:encoded: GG has definitely jumped the shark. Last night’s show was just bad bad bad. Kim was clearly uncomfortable and it was really uncomfortable to watch. WTF were they thinking? Ugh is right.
